    <dl>
           <dt>u 1</dt>
           <dd><em>u</em> the fifth letter and third short vowel of the alphabet, pronounced as the <em>u</em> in <em>full</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uk&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ra</em> m. the letter or sound <em>u</em></dd>

           <dt>u 2</dt>
           <dd><em>u</em> ind. an interjection of compassion, anger L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particle implying assent, calling, command L</dd>

           <dt>u 3</dt>
           <dd><em>u</em> ind. an enclitic copula used frequently in the Vedas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (as a particle implying restriction and antithesis, generally after pronominals, prepositions, particles, and before <em>nu</em> and <em>su</em>, equivalent to) and, also, further </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; on the other hand (especially in connexion with a relative, e.g. <em>ya u</em>, he on the contrary who &amp;c.) This particle may serve to give emphasis, like <em>id</em> and <em>eva</em>, especially after prepositions or demonstrative pronouns, in conjunction with <em>nu</em>, <em>vai</em>, <em>hi</em>, <em>cid</em>, &amp;c. (e.g. <em>ay&#x00e1;m u v&#x0101;m purut&#x00e1;mo</em>.. <em>johaviiti</em> [RV. iii, 62, 2], this very person <em>your worshipper</em> invokes you &amp;c.) It is especially used in the figure of speech called Anaphora, and particularly when the pronouns are repeated (e.g. <em>t&#x00e1;m u stu&#x1e63;a &#x00ed;ndram t&#x00e1;m g&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;&#x012b;&#x1e63;e</em> [RV. ii, 20, 4], him I praise, Indra, him I sing). It may be used in drawing a conclusion, like the English 'now' (e.g. <em>t&#x00e1;d u t&#x00e1;th&#x0101; n&#x00e1; kury&#x0101;t</em> [&#x015a;Br. v, 2, 2, 3], that now he should not do in such a manner), and is frequently found in interrogative sentences (e.g. <em>k&#x00e1; u t&#x00e1;c ciketa</em> [RV. i, 164, 48], who, I ask, should know that?) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini calls this particle <em>u&#x00f1;</em> to distinguish it from the interrogative <em>u</em>. In the Pada-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha it is written <em>&#x016b;m</em>. In the classical language <em>u</em> occurs only after <em>atha</em>, <em>na</em>, and <em>kim</em>, with a slight modification of the sense, and often only as an expletive ( <em>kim</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>u</em> - <em>u</em> or <em>u</em> - <em>uta</em>, on the one hand - on the other hand </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; partly - partly </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as, well - as</dd>

           <dt>u 4</dt>
           <dd><em>u</em> cl. 5. P. <em>unoti</em> ( <em>vy-u</em> RV. v, 31, 1): cl. 2. &#x0100;. (1. sg. <em>uv&#x00e9;</em> RV. x, 86, 7): cl. 1. &#x0100;. <em>avate</em> Dh&#x0101;tup </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to call to, hail </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to roar, bellow ( also <em>&#x00f4;ta</em> = <em>&#x0101;-uta</em>)</dd>

           <dt>u 5</dt>
           <dd><em>u</em> m. N. of &#x015a;iva </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also of Brahman L</dd>

           <dt>uka </dt>
           <dd><em>uka</em> ind., g. <em>c&#x00e2;di</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 57</dd>

           <dt>uka&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>uka&#x1e47;a</em> v. l. for <em>u&#x1e47;aka</em>, q.v. K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-1, 41</dd>

           <dt>ukan&#x0101;ha </dt>
           <dd><em>ukan&#x0101;ha</em> m. a horse of a red and yellow or red and black colour, a bay or chestnut horse L</dd>

           <dt>uku&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>uku&#x1e47;a</em> m. a bug L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; v. l. <em>utku&#x1e47;a</em></dd>

           <dt>ukta </dt>
           <dd><em>ukta</em> mfn. (p.p. of &#x221a;<em>vac</em>, q.v.), uttered, said, spoken </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of a divine being (v&#x1e37;. for <em>uktha</em>, q.v.) Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. word, sentence &#x015a;i&#x015b;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>, <em>&#x0101;</em>), n. f. a stanza of four lines (with one syllabic instant or one long or two short syllables in each) ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>ukhta</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uktatva </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tva</em> n. the being spoken or uttered S&#x0101;h</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uktanirv&#x0101;ha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;nirv&#x0101;ha</em> m. maintaining an assertion</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uktapu&#x1e43;ska </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pu&#x1e43;ska</em> a (feminine or neuter) word of which also a masculine is mentioned or exists (and whose meaning only differs from that of the masculine by the notion of gender </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. the word <em>ga&#x1e45;g&#x0101;</em> is not <em>ukta-pu&#x1e43;ska</em>, whereas such words as <em>&#x015b;ubhra</em> and <em>gr&#x0101;ma-&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em> are so </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;ita-pu&#x1e43;ska</em>) Vop. iv, 8</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uktap&#x016b;rva </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;p&#x016b;rva</em> mfn. spoken before or formerly MBh</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uktapratyukta </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of anthem or alternate song S&#x0101;h</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uktavat </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; ukti </dt>
           <dd><em>ukti</em> f. sentence, proclamation, speech, expression, word Mn. Pa&#x00f1;cat. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a worthy speech or word BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uktha </dt>
           <dd><em>ukth&#x00e1;</em> n. a saying, sentence, verse, eulogy, praise RV. AV. VS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in the ritual) a kind of recitation or certain recited verses forming a subdivision of the &#x015a;astras (they generally form a series, and are recited in contradistinction to the S&#x0101;man verses which are sung and to the Yajus or muttered sacrificial formulas) AitBr. TS. &#x015a;Br. ChUp. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (the <em>mahad-uktham</em> or <em>b&#x1e5b;had-uktham</em>, 'great Uktha', forms a series of verses, in three sections, each containing eighty T&#x1e5b;icas or triple verses, recited at the end of the Agnicayana) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the S&#x0101;ma-veda &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a kind of metre (four times one long or two short syllables) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a form of Agni MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a prince VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a divine being belonging to the Vi&#x015b;ve Dev&#x0101;s Hariv. 11542</dd>

           <dt>uk&#x1e63; 1</dt>
           <dd><em>uk&#x1e63;</em> cl. 1. P. &#x0100;. <em>uk&#x1e63;&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>uk&#x1e63;&#x00e1;te</em> (p. <em>&#x00fa;k&#x1e63;at</em> RV. i, 114, 7, and <em>uk&#x1e63;am&#x0101;&#x1e47;a</em> AV. iii, 12, 1 RV. iv, 42, 4, &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>ukha </dt>

           <dt>ugra </dt>
           <dd><em>ugr&#x00e1;</em> mfn. (said to be fr. &#x221a;<em>uc</em> [U&#x1e47;. ii, 29], but probably fr. a &#x221a;<em>uj</em>, or &#x221a;<em>vaj</em>, fr. which also <em>ojas</em>, <em>v&#x0101;ja</em>, <em>vajra</em> may be derived </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; compar. <em>ugratara</em> and <em>&#x00f3;j&#x012b;yas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; superl. <em>ugratama</em> and <em>&#x00f3;ji&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha</em>), powerful, violent, mighty, impetuous, strong, huge, formidable, terrible </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; the Ugra, according to Manu x, 9, is of cruel or rude [<em>kr&#x016b;ra</em>] conduct [<em>&#x0101;c&#x0101;ra</em>] and employment [<em>vih&#x0101;ra</em>], as killing or catching snakes &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but according to the Tantras he is an encomiast or bard) Mn. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a twice-born man who perpetrates dreadful deeds Comm. on &#x0100;p. i, 7, 20 &#x0100;p. Gaut </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a group of asterisms (viz. <em>p&#x016b;rva-ph&#x0101;lgun&#x012b;</em>, <em>p&#x016b;rv&#x00e2;&#x1e63;&#x0101;&#x1e0d;h&#x0101;</em>, <em>p&#x016b;rva-bh&#x0101;drapad&#x0101;</em>, <em>magh&#x0101;</em>, <em>bhara&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; wrath, anger ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>ughra</em>: Gk. ?, ?, Lat. [172, 2] <em>augeo</em> &amp;c.: Goth. <em>auka</em>, 'I increase' ; Lith. <em>ug-is</em>, 'growth, increase' ; <em>aug-u</em>, 'I grow', &amp;c.]</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to heave: Caus. <em>-chv&#x0101;sayati</em>, to cause to breathe again or recover </dd>

           <dt>ut </dt>
           <dd><em>ut</em> ind. a particle of doubt or deliberation (= 2. <em>uta</em>, q.v.) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (for the prep. <em>ud</em> 1. <em>ud</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>uta 1</dt>
           <dd><em>uta</em> mfn. (fr. &#x221a;<em>ve</em>, q.v.), sewn, woven</dd>

           <dt>uta 2</dt>
           <dd><em>ut&#x00e1;</em> ind. and, also, even, or RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. ChUp. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often used for the sake of emphasis, especially at the end of a line after <em>iti</em> or a verb (e.g. <em>sarva-bh&#x016b;t&#x0101;ni tam p&#x0101;rtha sad&#x0101; paribhavanty uta</em>, all creatures, O king, certainly always despise him MBh. iii, 1026) MBh. Bhag. &amp;c. (As an interrogative particle, generally at the beginning of the second or following part of a double interrogation) or, utrum - an (e.g. <em>katham nir&#x1e47;&#x012b;yate ki&#x1e43; sy&#x0101;n ni&#x1e63;k&#x0101;ra&#x1e47;o bandhur uta vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;sa-gh&#x0101;taka&#x1e25;</em>, how can it be decided whether he be a friend without a motive or a violator of confidence? Hit.) Kum. Kath&#x0101;s. Bhart&#x1e5b;. S&#x0101;h. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in this sense it may be strengthened by <em>&#x0101;ho</em> (e.g. <em>kaccit tvam asi m&#x0101;nu&#x1e63;&#x012b; ut&#x00e2;ho sur&#x00e2;&#x1e45;gan&#x0101;</em>, art thou a mortal woman or divine? Nala), or by <em>&#x0101;ho-svit</em> (e.g. <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;lihotra&#x1e25; ki&#x1e43; nu sy&#x0101;d ut&#x00e2;hosvid r&#x0101;j&#x0101; nala&#x1e25;</em>, can it be &#x015a;&#x0101;lihotra or king Nala?) Rarely <em>kim</em> is repeated before <em>uta</em> used in this sense (e.g. <em>kim nu svarg&#x0101;t pr&#x0101;pt&#x0101; tasy&#x0101; r&#x016b;pe&#x1e47;a kimut&#x00e2;ny&#x00e2;gat&#x0101;</em>, has she arrived from heaven or has another come in her form? M&#x1e5b;icch.) Amar. MBh. &amp;c. (As a particle of wishing, especially at the beginning of a sentence followed by a potential) would that! utinam! (e.g. <em>ut&#x00e2;dh&#x012b;y&#x012b;ta</em>, would that he would read!) (<em>uta</em> preceded by <em>kim</em>) on the contrary, how much more, how much less (e.g. <em>samartho'si sahasram api jetu&#x1e43; kimut&#x00e2;ikam</em>, thou art able to conquer even a thousand, how much more one R.) &#x015a;ak. Vikr. Ragh. &amp;c. (<em>uta</em> preceded by <em>prati</em>) on the contrary, rather (e.g. <em>e&#x1e63;a p&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;o'sm&#x0101;bhir na jalpati hanti praty-uta p&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x0101;&#x1e47;aih</em>, this one questioned by us does not speak, but rather throws stones at us) Kath&#x0101;s. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>uta v&#x0101;</em>, or else, and (e.g. <em>samudr&#x0101;d uta v&#x0101; pur&#x012b;&#x1e63;&#x0101;t</em>, from the sea or from the moisture in the air) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101;</em> - <em>uta v&#x0101;</em> or <em>ut&#x00e2;ho v&#x00e2;pi</em> - <em>v&#x0101;</em>, either - or </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>uta</em> - <em>uta</em>, both - and (e.g. <em>uta balav&#x0101;n ut&#x00e2;bala&#x1e25;</em>, both the strong and the weak) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kim</em> - <em>uta v&#x0101;</em>, whether - or else</dd>

           <dt>uta&#x1e45;ka </dt>
           <dd><em>uta&#x1e45;ka</em> m. N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ( also <em>utta&#x1e45;ka</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uta&#x1e45;kamegha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;megha</em> m. a kind of cloud named after that &#x1e5a;ishi MBh</dd>

           <dt>utkand </dt>

           <dt>uttama </dt>
           <dd><em>ut-tam&#x00e1;</em> mfn. (superlative fr. 1. <em>ud</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; opposed to <em>avama</em>, <em>adhama</em>, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>an-uttama</em>), uppermost, highest, chief </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; most elevated, principal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; best, excellent RV. AV. AitBr. Mn. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c. (often ifc., e.g. <em>dvij&#x00f4;ttama</em>, best of the twice-born, i.e. a Br&#x0101;hman Mn.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; first, greatest </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the highest (tone) &#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; m. the last person (= in European grammars the first person) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. K&#x0101;ty. K&#x0101;&#x015b;. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd><em>uttam&#x012b;ya</em> mfn. (g. <em>gah&#x00e2;di</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-1, 138) belonging to anything excellent or best or last &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uttara 1</dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00fa;ttara</em> mfn. (compar. fr. 1. <em>ud</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; opposed to <em>adhara</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; declined Gram. 238. <em>a</em>), upper, higher, superior (e.g. <em>uttare dant&#x0101;s</em>, the upper teeth) RV. AV. TS. ChUp. Ragh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; northern (because the northern part of India is high) AV. Mn. Su&#x015b;r. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; left (opposed to <em>dak&#x1e63;i&#x1e47;a</em> or right, because in praying the face being turned to the east the north would be on the left hand) AV. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; later, following, subsequent, latter, concluding, posterior, future RV. AV. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. MBh. Ragh. Hit. &amp;c. (opposed to <em>p&#x016b;rva</em>, &amp;c., e.g. <em>uttara&#x1e25; k&#x0101;la&#x1e25;</em>, future time </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>uttara&#x1e43; v&#x0101;kyam</em>, a following speech, answer, reply </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>phalam uttaram</em>, subsequent result, future consequence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x1e63;&#x00f4;ttare&#x1e63;u</em>, in future years) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; followed by (e.g. <em>sm&#x00f4;ttara</em> mfn. followed by '<em>sma</em>' P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-3, 176) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; superior, chief, excellent, dominant, predominant, more powerful RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gaining a cause (in law) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; better, more excellent RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of a son of Vir&#x0101;&#x1e6d;a MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a king of the N&#x0101;gas L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a mountain Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of several men </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;s</em>), m. pl., N. of a school </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), of. (scil. <em>di&#x015b;</em>) the northern quarter, the north Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of each of the Nakshatras that contain the word '<em>uttara</em>' (cf. <em>uttara-phalgun&#x012b;</em>, &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a daughter of Vir&#x0101;&#x1e6d;a and daughter-in-law of Arjuna MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a female servant Lalit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e</em>), f. du. the second and third verse of a T&#x1e5b;ica (or a stanza consisting of three verses) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;s</em>), f. pl. the second part of the S&#x0101;ma-sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. upper surface or cover MBh. Ragh. Da&#x015b;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the north R. Dh&#x016b;rtas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the following member, the last part of a compound </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; answer, reply Ragh. R. Prab. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in law) a defence, rejoinder, a defensive measure </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; contradiction Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in the Mim&#x0101;&#x1e43;s&#x0101; philosophy) the answer (the fourth member of an adhikara&#x1e47;a or case) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; superiority, excellence, competency R. Pa&#x00f1;cat. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; result, the chief or prevalent result or characteristic, what remains or is left, conclusion, remainder, excess, over and above, (often ifc., e.g. <em>bhay&#x00f4;ttara</em>, attended with danger, having danger as the result </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>dharm&#x00f4;ttara</em>, chiefly characterized by virtue </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x1e63;a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;y-uttara&#x1e43; sahasram</em>, one thousand with an excess of sixty, i.e. 1060 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>sapt&#x00f4;ttara&#x1e43; &#x015b;atam</em>, 107) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; remainder, difference (in arithmetic) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a song Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of each of the Nakshatras that contain the word '<em>uttara</em>' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular figure in rhetoric </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the last book of the R&#x0101;m&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. at the conclusion, at the end, e.g. <em>bhavad-uttaram</em>, having the word '<em>bhavat</em>' at the end </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>asr&#x00f4;ttaram &#x012b;k&#x1e63;it&#x0101;</em>, looked at with tears at the close, i.e. with a glance ending in tears </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; afterwards, thereafter </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; behind MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the following part (of a book) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ?.]</dd>

           <dt>utpala 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ut-pala</em> n. (and m. L.), (&#x221a;<em>pal</em> 'to move' T </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fr. <em>pal</em> = &#x221a;<em>pa&#x1e6d;</em>, 'to burst open' BRD.), the blossom of the blue lotus (Nymphaea Caerulea) MBh. R. Su&#x015b;r. Ragh. Megh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a seed of the Nymphaea Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the plant Costus Speciosus Bhpr. VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any water-lily </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any flower L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular hell (Buddh.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of a N&#x0101;ga </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of an astronomer </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a lexicographer </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of several other men </dd>

           <dd><em>utsvapn&#x0101;yita</em> n. the act of starting out of sleep, dreaming uneasily S&#x0101;h. 219</dd>

           <dt>ud 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ud</em> a particle and prefix to verbs and nouns. (As implying superiority in place, rank, station, or power) up, upwards </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; upon, on </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; over, above. (As implying separation and disjunction) out, out of, from, off, away from, apart. (According to native authorities <em>ud</em> may also imply publicity, pride, indisposition, weakness, helplessness, binding, loosing, existence, acquisition.) <em>ud</em> is not used as a separable adverb or preposition </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in those rare cases, in which it appears in the Veda uncompounded with a verb, the latter has to be supplied from the context (e.g. <em>&#x00fa;d &#x00fa;tsam &#x015b;at&#x00e1;dh&#x0101;ram</em> AV. iii, 24, 4, out (pour) a fountain of a hundred streams). <em>ud</em> is sometimes repeated in the Veda to fill out the verse P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-1, 6 (<em>ki&#x1e43; na ud ud u har&#x1e63;ase d&#x0101;tav&#x0101; u</em> K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.) [Cf. Zd. <em>u&#x015b;</em> ; Hib. <em>uas</em> and in composition <em>os</em>, <em>ois</em> e.g. <em>os-car</em>, 'a leap, bound', &amp;c. also <em>uttam&#x00e1;</em>, 1. <em>&#x00fa;ttara</em>, &amp;c.]</dd>

           <dt>ud 2</dt>
           <dd><em>ud</em> or <em>und</em>, cl. 7. P. <em>un&#x00e1;tti</em> (RV. v, 85, 4): cl. 6. P. <em>undati</em> (p. <em>und&#x00e1;t</em> RV. ii, 3, 2: Impv. 3. pl. <em>undantu</em> AV. vi, 68, 1 ; 2), &#x0100;. <em>und&#x00e1;te</em> (AV. v, 19, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>und&#x0101;&#x1e43; cak&#x0101;ra</em>, <em>undi&#x1e63;yati</em> &amp;c. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxix, 20) to flow or issue out, spring (as water) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wet, bathe RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. &#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;. P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b;. &amp;c.: Caus. (aor. <em>aundidat</em> Vop. xviii, 1): Desid. <em>undidi&#x1e63;ati</em> K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-1, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ? ; Lat. <em>unda</em> ; Goth. <em>vat-o</em> ; Old High Germ. [183, 1] <em>wa&#x015b;-ar</em> ; Mod. Eng. <em>wat-er</em> ; Lith. <em>wand-&#x016b;4</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; utta </dt>
           <dd><em>utta</em> mfn. moistened, wet L. (cf. <em>unna</em>, col. 3.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uda </dt>
           <dd><em>uda</em> n. (only at the beginning or end of a compound) water</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; udakama&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;alu </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kama&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;al&#x00fa;</em> m. a water-jar &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; udak&#x012b;r&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x012b;r&#x1e47;a</em> or m. the tree Galedupa Piscidia (the bark of which is ground and scattered on water to stupefy fishes) Bhpr</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; udak&#x012b;rya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x012b;rya</em> m. the tree Galedupa Piscidia (the bark of which is ground and scattered on water to stupefy fishes) Bhpr</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; udak&#x012b;ry&#x0101; </dt>

           <dt>uddharma </dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dharma</em> m. unsound doctrine, heresy</dd>

           <dt>uddhar&#x1e63;a 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dhar&#x1e63;a</em> (for 2. p. 189, col. 3), m. (&#x221a;<em>dh&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;</em>), courage to undertake anything R</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uddhar&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dhar&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a</em> (for 2. p. 189, col. 3), mfn. animating, encouraging R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. the act of animating or encouraging MBh</dd>

           <dt>uddhava </dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dhava</em> m. (&#x221a;<em>hu</em>), sacrificial fire L. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p189-1"></a>[Page 189, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a festival, holiday L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; joy, pleasure L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Y&#x0101;dava (K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a's friend and counsellor) MBh. Hariv. VP. BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uddhavad&#x016b;ta </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;d&#x016b;ta</em> and m. N. of two poems</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uddhavasa&#x1e43;de&#x015b;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sa&#x1e43;de&#x015b;a</em> m. N. of two poems</dd>

           <dt>uddhas </dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dhas</em> (<em>ud-&#x221a;has</em>), P. <em>-dhasati</em>, to break out into laughter (said of the lightning) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to flash BhP. iii, 12, 6</dd>

           <dt>uddhasta </dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dhasta</em> mfn. (<em>hasta</em> with <em>ud</em>) extending the hands, raising the hands Su&#x015b;r. ii, 533, 10</dd>

           <dt>uddh&#x0101; 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dh&#x0101;</em> (<em>ud-&#x221a;dh&#x0101;</em>), P. (Subj. 2. pl. <em>-dadh&#x0101;tana</em>) to erect (<em>kap&#x1e5b;th&#x00e1;m</em>) RV. x, 101, 12 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to expose (an infant) &#x015a;Br. iv, 5, 2, 13</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uddhi </dt>
           <dd><em>ud-dh&#x00ed;</em> m. the seat of a carriage AV. viii, 8, 22 &#x015a;Br. xii, 2, 2, 2 TBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an earthen stand on which the Ukh&#x0101; rests &#x015a;Br. K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uddhita </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00fa;d-dhita</em> mfn. erected, raised, built up AV. ix, 3, 6 ; ix, 42, 2 &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exposed RV. viii, 51, 2 AV. xviii, 2, 34</dd>

           <dt>uddh&#x0101; 2</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; also below) to go upwards, move upwards, rise up RV. AV. viii, 7, 21 VS. TBr. BhP. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to open (as a door) RV. ix, 5, 5 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to go out or away, start from, leave RV. v, 5, 1 Da&#x015b;. Naish. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; unm&#x016b;lan&#x012b;ya </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; to receive, get RV. v, 52, 17 ; x, 167, 4 AV. xviii, 3, 73 TS. iii, 2, 3, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; P. &#x0100;. <em>-m&#x0101;r&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em>, <em>-m&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;e</em>, to stroke, make smooth </dd>

           <dt>unme&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>un-me&#x1e63;a</em> &amp;c. col. 2</dd>

           <dt>upa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00fa;pa</em> ind. (a preposition or prefix to verbs and nouns, expressing) towards, near to (opposed to <em>apa</em>, away), by the side of, with, together with, under, down (e.g. <em>upa-&#x221a;gam</em>, to go near, undergo </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upa-gamana</em>, approaching </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Veda the verb has sometimes to be supplied from the context, and sometimes <em>upa</em> is placed after the verb to which it belongs, e.g. <em>&#x0101;yayur upa</em> = <em>up&#x00e2;yayu&#x1e25;</em>, they approached). (As unconnected with verbs and prefixed to nouns <em>upa</em> expresses) direction towards, nearness, contiguity in space, time, number, degree, resemblance, and relationship, but with the idea of subordination and inferiority (e.g. <em>upa-kani&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hik&#x0101;</em>, the finger next to the little finger </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upa-pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;am</em>, a secondary or subordinate Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upa-da&#x015b;a</em>, nearly ten) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes forming with the nouns to which it is prefixed compound adverbs (e.g. <em>upa-m&#x016b;lam</em>, at the &#x221a; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upa-p&#x016b;rva-r&#x0101;tram</em>, towards the beginning of night </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upa-k&#x016b;pe</em>, near a well) which lose their adverbial terminations if they are again compounded with nouns (e.g. <em>upak&#x016b;pa-jal&#x00e2;&#x015b;aya</em>, a reservoir in the neighbourhood of a well) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; prefixed to proper names <em>upa</em> may express in classical literature 'a younger brother' (e.g. <em>up&#x00ea;ndra</em>, 'the younger brother of Indra'), and in Buddhist literature 'a son.' (As a separable adverb <em>upa</em> rarely expresses) thereto, further, moreover (e.g. <em>tatr&#x00f4;pa brahma yo veda</em>, who further knows the Brahman) RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b;. (As a separable preposition) near to, towards, in the direction of, under, below (with acc., e.g. <em>upa &#x0101;&#x015b;&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, towards the regions) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; near to, at, on, upon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the time of, upon, up to, in, above (with loc., e.g. <em>upa s&#x0101;nu&#x1e63;u</em>, on the tops of the mountains) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p195-1"></a>[Page 195, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with, together with, at the same time with, according to (with inst., e.g. <em>upa dharmabhi&#x1e25;</em>, according to the rules of duty) RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. <em>upa</em>, besides the meanings given above, is said by native authorities to imply disease, extinction </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ornament </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; command </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; reproof </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; undertaking </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; giving </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; killing </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; diffusing </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wish </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; power </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; effort </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; resemblance, &amp;c. ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>upa</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>sub</em> ; Goth. <em>uf</em> ; Old [195, 1] Germ. <em>oba</em> ; Mod. Germ. <em>ob</em> in <em>Obdach</em>, <em>obliegen</em>, &amp;c.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upaka </dt>
           <dd><em>upaka</em> m. a diminutive for all proper names of men beginning with <em>upa</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-3, 80</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; upak&#x0101;di </dt>
           <dd><em>upak&#x00e2;di</em> m. a ga&#x1e47;a P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-4, 69</dd>

           <dt>upak&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-k&#x1e5b;</em> &#x221a;1. P. &#x0100;. <em>-karoti</em>, <em>-kurute</em>, to bring or put near to, furnish with, provide Mn. Vikr. Ratn&#x0101;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to assist, help, favour, benefit, cause to succeed or prosper R. Mn. Megh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to foster, take care of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to serve, do homage to (with acc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; only &#x0100;. by P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 32 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but MBh. i, 6408) &#x015a;Br. R&#x0101;jat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to undertake, begin, set about R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to scold, insult Vop. xxiii, 25 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upa-sk&#x1e5b;</em> (<em>s</em> inserted or perhaps original), &#x0100;. <em>-skurute</em>, to add, supply P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Vop. Siddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to furnish with </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to prepare, elaborate, arrange, get ready </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to adorn, decorate, ornament </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to deform, disfigure, derange, disorder, spoil </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to take care for P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;. K&#x0101;&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to bring together, assemble</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upakara&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-kara&#x1e47;a</em> n. the act of doing anything for another, doing a service or favour, helping, assisting, benefiting Pa&#x00f1;cat. S&#x0101;h. Subh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; instrument, implement, machine, engine, apparatus, paraphernalia (as the vessels at a sacrifice &amp;c.) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. Mn. &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>upani&#x1e63;ad 1</dt>
           <dd><em>upa-ni-&#x1e63;ad</em> (<em>upa-ni-&#x221a;sad</em>), P. (pf. <em>-n&#x00ed;-&#x1e63;edus</em>) to sit down near to </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upani&#x1e63;ad 2</dt>
           <dd><em>upa-ni&#x1e63;&#x00e1;d</em> <em>t</em> f. (according to some) the sitting down at the feet of another to listen to his words (and hence, secret knowledge given in this manner </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but according to native authorities <em>upani&#x1e63;ad</em> means 'setting at rest ignorance by revealing the knowledge of the supreme spirit') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the mystery which underlies or rests underneath the external system of things (cf. IW. p. 35 seqq.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; esoteric doctrine, secret doctrine, mysterious or mystical meaning, words of mystery &amp;c. &#x015a;Br. ChUp. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a class of philosophical writings (more than a hundred in number, attached to the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as <em>but iii&#x015b;opanishad</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; their aim is the exposition of the secret meaning of the Veda, and they are regarded as the source of the Ved&#x0101;nta and S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya philosophies </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for the most important of the Upanishads, IW. p. 37 seq.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upanaya </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-naya</em> m. the bringing near, procuring MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; attaining, obtaining, obtainment BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; employment, application R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; application (the fourth member in a five fold syllogism) Sarvad. Tarkas. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; introduction (into any science) VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; initiation = the next L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upanayana </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-nayana</em> n. the act of leading to or near, bringing R. BhP. Vikr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; employment, application Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; introduction (into any science) Prab </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; leading or drawing towards one's self </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; that ceremony in which a Guru draws a boy towards himself and initiates him into one of the three twice-born classes (one of the twelve Sa&#x1e43;sk&#x0101;ras or purificatory rites <em>prescribed in the &#x1e0d;harma-s&#x016b;tras and explained in the &#x1e45;&#x1e5b;ihya-s&#x016b;tras</em> in which the boy is invested with the sacred thread <em>different for the three castes</em> and thus endowed with second or spiritual birth and qualified to learn the Veda by heart </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a Br&#x0101;hman is initiated in the eighth year [or seventh according to Hiranyake&#x015b;in </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or eighth from conception, according to &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x0101;yana &amp;c.], a Kshatriya in the eleventh, a Vai&#x015b;ya in the twelfth </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but the term could be delayed) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; IW. p. 201 RTL. p. 360 seqq. &#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;. i, 19-22 &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;. ii, 1-6 P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b;. ii, 2-5 Gobh. ii, 10 HirG&#x1e5b;. i, 1 seqq. Mn. ii, 36 Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. i, 14</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; upanayanacint&#x0101;ma&#x1e47;i </dt>

           <dd><em>upa-rama</em> m. cessation, stopping, expiration MBh. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; leaving off, desisting, giving up Su&#x015b;r. S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khyak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; death K&#x0101;d</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; uparamatva </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tva</em> n. the state of ceasing from (all worldly desires and actions) Ved&#x0101;ntas</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; uparama&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-rama&#x1e47;a</em> n. the abstaining from worldly actions or desires Ved&#x0101;ntas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ceasing, discontinuance. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p205-1"></a>[Page 205, Column 1]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upar&#x0101;ma </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-r&#x0101;ma</em> m. ceasing, stopping, desisting</dd>

           <dt>uparambh </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-&#x221a;rambh</em> P. <em>-rambhati</em>, to cause to resound BhP. x, 35, 12</dd>

           <dt>uparava </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-rava</em> m. (&#x221a;<em>ru</em>), a hole (over which the Soma is ground </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; so called from its increasing the sound of the grindstones) TS. &#x015a;Br. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upar&#x0101;va </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-r&#x0101;va</em> m. a near sound <em>&#x1e6d;.</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-3, 22</dd>

           <dt>uparasa </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-rasa</em> m. a secondary mineral (as red chalk, bitumen &amp;c.) Bhpr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a secondary feeling or passion L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a secondary flavour L</dd>

           <dt>upar&#x0101;ja </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-r&#x0101;ja</em> m. a viceroy, g. <em>k&#x0101;&#x015b;y&#x0101;di</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-2, 116</dd>

           <dt>upar&#x0101;jam </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-r&#x0101;jam</em> ind. near a king P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-4, 108 K&#x0101;&#x015b;</dd>

           <dt>upar&#x0101;dhaya </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-r&#x0101;dhaya</em> mfn. (&#x221a;<em>r&#x0101;dh</em>), propitiating, doing homage, g. <em>br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;&#x00e2;di</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-1, 124</dd>

           <dt>upar&#x0101;mam </dt>
           <dd><em>upa-r&#x0101;mam</em> ind. near R&#x0101;ma T</dd>

           <dt>upari </dt>
           <dd><em>up&#x00e1;ri</em> ind. (as a separable adverb) above, upon, on, upwards, towards the upper side of (opposed to <em>adhas</em> and, <em>n&#x012b;c&#x0101;</em> e.g. <em>upari-&#x221a;y&#x0101;</em>, to go upwards </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes written with a following word as if compounded with it, below) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; besides, in addition to, further (<em>sahasra&#x1e43; &#x015b;at&#x0101;ny upari c&#x00e2;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;au</em>, 1000 and 800 in addition) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; afterwards (e.g. <em>upari paya&#x1e25; pibet</em>, he should drink milk afterwards) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upary upari</em>, higher and higher </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; repeatedly, continuously RV. &amp;c. (As a separable preposition, with acc., loc., or gen.) over, above, upon, on, at the head of, on the upper side of, beyond (e.g. <em>upari &#x015b;aila&#x1e43;-&#x221a;gam</em>, to go over the mountain </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upari la&#x1e45;k&#x0101;y&#x0101;&#x1e43; sampr&#x0101;pta&#x1e25; sa&#x1e25;</em>, he arrived over La&#x1e45;k&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>upary upari sarve&#x1e63;&#x0101;m ati&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hat</em>, he stood at the very head of all </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;tm&#x0101;na&#x1e43; tasya upari k&#x1e63;iptv&#x0101;</em>, having thrown himself upon him) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in connection with, with reference to, with regard to, towards (with gen., e.g. <em>mam&#x00f4;pari vik&#x0101;rita&#x1e25;</em>, changed in feeling with regard to me </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>putrasy&#x00f4;pari kruddha&#x1e25;</em>, enraged towards his son) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; after (with abl., e.g. <em>muh&#x016b;rt&#x0101;d upari</em>, after a minute </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also <em>tad-upari</em> &amp;c.) RV. &amp;c. ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zend">Zend.</a> <em>upairi</em> ; Goth. <em>ufar</em> ; Old Germ. <em>obar</em> ; Mod. Germ. [ber] ; Eng. <em>over</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>super</em>.] [205, 1]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upari </dt>
           <dd><em>upari</em> may stand first in a compound, as in the following examples:</dd>

           <dd><em>upa-rudh</em> &#x221a;2. P. &#x0100;. <em>-ru&#x1e47;addhi</em>, <em>-runddhe</em>, and <em>-rundhati</em>, <em>-te</em> (also <em>-rodhati</em> R. vii, 74, 7) to lock in, shut up, besiege, blockade TBr. &#x015a;Br. ChUp. Mn. &#x015a;i&#x015b;. &amp;c </dd>

'subordinate, secondary' (opposed to <em>pradh&#x0101;na</em>), any word which by composition or derivation loses its original independence while it also determines the sense of another word (e.g. the word <em>r&#x0101;jan</em> in <em>r&#x0101;japuru&#x1e63;a</em>, 'a king's servant or minister', and the word <em>api&#x015b;ali</em> in <em>&#x0101;pi&#x015b;ala</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-2, 43, &amp;c. ; vi, 2, 36 </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a subdivision </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a supplementary or additional work, secondary portion of a science MBh. Hariv. &amp;c. (such as the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as, the Ny&#x0101;ya, Mim&#x0101;&#x1e43;s&#x0101;, and the Dharma-&#x015b;&#x0101;stras) </dd>

           <dt>upe 1</dt>
           <dd><em>up&#x00ea;</em> (<em>upa-&#x221a;i</em>), P. <em>-eti</em>, to go or come or step near, approach, betake one's self to, arrive at, meet with, turn towards RV. AV. TS. &#x015a;Br. MBh. &#x015a;ak. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; undergo, suffer RV. iv, 33, 2 &#x015a;Br. AitBr. Ragh. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to approach sexually TS. ii, v Mn. ix, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xi, 172 MBh. Su&#x015b;r. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to approach a teacher, become a pupil &#x015a;Br. x, xi B&#x1e5b;&#x0100;rUp. ChUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to occur, be present, make one's appearance RPr&#x0101;t. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to happen, fall to one's share, befall, incur RV. i, 167, 1 ; vii, 84, 3 Hit. Bhag. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to join (in singing) &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to regard as, admit, acknowledge S&#x0101;h. Comm. on Ny&#x0101;yam </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to comprehend, understand Sarvad.: Intens. &#x0100;. (1. pl. <em>-&#x012b;mahe</em>) to implore (a god) RV. x, 24, 2</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; upayat 2</dt>
           <dd><em>upa-yat</em> (for 1. s.v.), mfn. going near, approaching &amp;c </dd>
